Author: fjpoblam
Subject: Major gripes
Body:
“Pocket”? Complete waste of resource. I already have news apps, don’t need suggestions, DON’T want to be tracked for suggestions! Period.

Firefox should in no way ever need Background App Refresh.

First time I tried to login to sync carefully constructed laptop bookmark structure, my valid login was rejected. No sync.

There is no Favorites bar for efficient quick access to frequent websites.

Many websites are slow to load.

There should be *instant* sync between “favorite” bookmarks and “Top Sites”. Again, USER efficiency.

If Firefox is indeed interested in privacy, then Duckduckgo should be the incoming default search engine—not Google.

All this, dealbreaker. For now. I’ll continue to dally with betas.

Author: Hj342
Subject: Un dernier effort

- la possibilité d'une barre de recherche distincte de la barre d'adresse ;
- la possibilité d'onglets en ligne comme sur la version PC au lieu de seulement les vignettes
- un gestionnaire de fichiers téléchargés avec également partage et transfert par wifi / FTP (une sorte de " FileApp " combiné)
Translated Body: No complaints in fluidity and reliability (true to the PC verion). But improvements to make it as complete as its PC version (that the fire and regrettable web browser "Mercury" (iLegend Soft or Lucy Ding, a member of its developers) were able to achieve) would be appreciated in order to make optimal and so the best it is possible within the app store: - the possibility of a search bar separate from the address bar; - the possibility of online tabs as on the PC version instead of just the thumbnails - a downloaded file manager with also sharing and transfer via wifi / FTP (a kind of "FileApp" combined)

Author: DavoColo
Subject: Still wishing for a few features
Body:
I’m enjoying the wonderfulness of Firefox Photon, especially on the desktop. I’ve never seen the crashes, freezes, sync issues, or partial page loads that others mention. FF always works perfectly for me on iOS (and macOS and Linux for that matter). 

And, to be fair, many of the one-star reviews are from people who don’t know they can configure privacy controls, the homepage contents, Pocket and more — just like they want. That’s user error, not FF guys. 

My issues with FF involve missing features and interface oddities primarily. 

Here’s the main thing: The ability — finally — to edit bookmarks on the mobile device and sync to desktop is still not there. 

Sure, you can save a bookmark in a special “Mobile” folder and sync it back to the desktop version where you can then process it properly, move and rename it, and sync it back to iOS. (Whew!)

That’s a non-starter for me. 

You still can’t edit the bookmark name or URL, or save it into the main bookmark tree via iOS. Safari on desktop and iOS has been capable of this for how many years?

It’s the dealbreaker keeping me from moving to FF full time on iOS. 

My other gripe is the inability to set the app in permanent private mode, or set it to clear history and cookies on close, as you can in the desktop version. These are crucial to those of us who use FF primarily for its finely grained privacy settings. I’m surprised Mozilla has fallen down on this. 

Come on Mozilla, put some of that half-billion in search income into the mobile space! This is crucial for maintaining some kind of viability in the desktop space as well.

Subject: Battery usage gone up?
Body:

There’s a few bugs with a few features: night mode glitches out on lots of images (showing inverted photos), and sometimes persists image data from private sessions to ‘normal’ sessions. Occasionally after refreshing a page a few times, the app will not complete loading the body text, and you’ll need you to close a tab and re-open it in a fresh tab. All minor things that you can live with, they’re just enough to keep me from giving this a 5-Star.

Feature-wise, I often find the UX confusing between the two types of expand nav buttons (hamburger menu vs a ‘...’ menu), it’d be great to consolidate these.  I’d love having a chance to re-arrange the nav buttons; I can’t really reach the back button with my right thumb, and it’d be great to move that closer (as it’s my most commonly tapped object!). Subject: Bookmarks not editable AFAIK; can’t “view source”; no “Open in”

Beyond that, nothing. Can’t edit bookmarks AFAIK except by editing on laptop. Syncing is slovenly. Can’t “view source” (easy with a tricky Safari bookmark).

The Mozilla folk didn’t see fit to register Firefox as an app available in the Share activities (“Open In”). Heck, I can open most stuff even in my Wikipedia reader app. It should be no big deal for Mozilla to get Firefox down in the list.

Bookmarks, view source, open-in: dealbreakers for me.

Author: Pablo Gonzalez Mereides
Subject: Verbesserungswürdig
Body:
*iOS 11.2.2 - iPhone 7/ iPad Air 1*

Leider stürzt Firefox im privaten Modus immer ab, sobald man ein Tab schließt und einen neuen öffnet. 
Nervig

++ ab 5.0 ++

Wenn man sich auf einer Seite einloggt und oder in die Tab Übersicht geht, funktioniert die zurück Funktion nicht mehr. Als hätte man einen neuen Tab geöffnet. Furchtbar 
++

Leider ist der Browser ein bisschen langsam und Java Seiten wie Amazon oder eBay wollen die Bilder nicht richtig anzeigen bzw die Bilder lassen sich nicht weiterwischen. 

Außerdem sind die Tabs umständlich gelöst. Im Übersicht Modus ruckelt es ordentlich. 

Umständlich ist auch die Anordnung der Einstellungen. Etwas, das man öfters nutzt, wie das Löschen der History/Cookies, sinkt immer weiter nach unten. 
Sowas gehört höher!

Völlig daneben finde ich die Lösung der Favoriten, denn beim Start des Browsers ist man im History Modus, nicht wie beim Safari im Lesezeichen/ Favoriten Modus. Auch der Favoriten Stern in der unteren Leiste muss weg. Da gehört der Tab Switcher hin, denn immer dafür nach oben zu manövrieren ist umständlich, weil sich die anderen Aktionen unten sind ...

Toll fände ich auch den Browser im privaten Modus starten zu lassen, leider muss man den jedesmal neu aktivieren. 

Generell freue ich mich aber auf den Firefox, wurde er von Mozilla doch anfangs aufgegeben für iOS. Es gibt leider auch noch sehr viel Luft nach oben. 

Ob Apple es Drittanbieter Browser auch erlaubt AddOns wie AdBlocks zu nutzen?
Translated Body: * iOS 11.2.2 - iPhone 7 / iPad Air 1 * Unfortunately, Firefox always crashes in private mode as soon as you close a tab and open a new one. Annoying ++ from 5.0 ++ If you log in on a page and or go to the tab overview, the back function does not work anymore. Like having opened a new tab. Terrible ++ Unfortunately, the browser is a bit slow and Java sites like Amazon or eBay do not want to display the images properly or the images can not be wiped. In addition, the tabs are cumbersome. In the overview mode it jerky neat. The arrangement of the settings is also awkward. Something that is often used, such as clearing the history / cookies, continues to fall down. That's higher! Completely wrong, I find the solution of the favorites, because when you start the browser you are in the history mode, unlike the Safari in Bookmark / Favorites mode. Even the favorite star in the bottom bar has gone. There is the tab switcher, because always maneuvering upwards is cumbersome, because the other actions are below ... Great I would also like to start the browser in private mode, unfortunately, you have to re-activate each time. In general, I'm looking forward to the Firefox, he was initially abandoned by Mozilla for iOS. Unfortunately, there is still a lot of room for improvement. Whether Apple's third-party browser also allows to use AddOns like AdBlocks?

Author: fjpoblam
Subject: Bookmarks not editable AFAIK; can’t “view source”; no “Open in”
Body:
Advantage over Safari? Granular control over what parts of browser data may be purged: JUST history or JUST cookies or JUST cache… (Safari gives you all or nothing). And you can ship “mailto” links elsewhere instead of Mail.

Beyond that, nothing. Can’t edit bookmarks AFAIK. Can’t “view source” (easy with a tricky Safari bookmark).

The Mozilla folk didn’t see fit to register Firefox as an app available in the Share activities (“Open In”). Heck, I can open most stuff even in my Wikipedia reader app. It should be no big deal for Mozilla to get Firefox down in the list.

Bookmarks, view source, open-in: dealbreakers for me.

Subject: Privacy, my rear
Body: Mozilla used to focus on user privacy and didn't just vacuum up user data and sell it to the highest bidder, but that seems to be constantly eroding. I'm done, good luck Mozilla as you are no better than Chrome now, in my humble opinion.

Subject: 気に入ってます
Body:

なお、夜間モード中にアドレスバーなどが白いままだと眩しいので、もう少しコントラストを落としてもらえるとより嬉しいです。

あと大量のタブを開いているとき、よりスムーズに左右のタブに行き来できるUIが追加されると嬉しいです。特にiPadで使用中に画面の上部まで手を伸ばすのが少し不便でして。色々なブラウザが色々なアプローチを試していますが、何か良い方法をよろしくお願いします！
Translated Body: I love it on all of the iPad, iPhone, Mac. Even if you open a large number of tabs, it will not be late, and I like a lot of ambitious features such as night mode. If the address bar etc is still white during night mode, it will be dazzling, so it will be more pleasing to have a bit more contrast. I'm also happy to have added a UI that allows you to go to the right and left tabs more smoothly when a lot of tabs are open. Especially it is a little inconvenient to reach out to the top of the screen while using on iPad. Various browsers are experimenting with various approaches, but thank you for something nice way!

Author: Tamuh
Subject: Night Mode und schrecklichstes UI
Body:
Auf dem Mac ist Firefox schon nicht mehr favorisierter Browser, da er nichts mehr von den Vorteilen hat, die er vor der 57er Version hatte. Habe damals schon von Opera zu Firefox gewechselt, als Opera meinte, einen super Browser mit "toller" Benutzeroberfläche und "noch besserem" Innenleben "verbessern" zu müssen. Inzwischen macht selbst Mozilla solch einen Schrott. Dass dann aber auch noch im mobilen Browser das UI derart verschlimmbessert wird, ist wirklich nur noch traurig. Das häufige Wechseln des UI ist schon mehr als nervig. Besonders wenn man sich gerade mal wieder an etwas gewöhnt hat, fällt es doch einige Zeit lang schwer, den gewollten Button am richtigen Fleck zu finden - oben oder unten...

Was mich zumindest etwas freuen würde, wäre die Wiederherstellung des vorherigen Nachtmodus. Als sich alles einfach verdunkelt hat, war es angenehm, auch auf Seiten zu lesen, die einen schwarzen bzw einfach dunklen Hintergrund haben. Mit dem neuen Night Mode, der aus schwarz weiß und aus weiß schwarz macht, ist das nun ein einziger Krampf geworden. Schwarze Hintergründe werden brüllend grell und sind des nachts einfach nur noch unlesbar. Und die weißen Balken oben und unten gehen schon mal gar nicht. Welchen Sinn hat ein Nachtmodus, wenn man die App durch diese Balken dennoch als Taschenlampe verwenden kann? Ändert das doch bitte wieder!
Translated Subject: Night Mode and the most awful UI
Translated Body: On the Mac, Firefox is no longer favorite browser, because he has nothing of the advantages he had before the 57er version. I already switched from Opera to Firefox when Opera said I had to "improve" a great browser with a "great" user interface and "even better" inner life. Meanwhile, even Mozilla makes such a junk. That then but also in the mobile browser, the UI is so worsened, is really only sad. The frequent change of the UI is more than annoying. Especially if you have just gotten used to something, but it is sometimes hard to find the desired button in the right place - up or down ... What I would be happy at least something, would be the restoration of the previous night mode. When everything just darkened, it was nice to read on pages that have a black or dark background. With the new Night Mode, which turns black and white into black, it has now become a single cramp. Black backgrounds become roaring and are simply unreadable at night. And the white bars above and below do not even go. What's the point of having a night mode if you still can use the app as a flashlight through these bars? Please change that again!

Subject: Some interface tweaks would really improve it
Body:
The biggest reason to use Firefox mobile for iOS is if you're using it on your desktop. Why? On iOS there's no ad blocking for third party browsers, and you can't set it as your default browser, so you'll still have to use Safari sometimes too. 

Firefox could make accessing your tabs across devices a lot more seamless (ok, like Safari's), but they instead hide the feature too many taps away (they do this on the desktop browser too). It's the best reason to use FF for iOS, and they hide it!

Furthermore, since you can't set this as a default browser, and since you can't open links from all apps in Firefox (although some apps do, and they rock!), then Firefox should AT LEAST include a share add on for other apps that allows you to open the browser to that page, right? Instead, it's for sending a tab to a device or sending it to your reading list. Why? Do you not want us using your app?
I fortunately have Opener, which I set to open links in FF, but it's still more tapping and waiting than a simple "Open in Firefox" tool would be. 

Seriously, Mozilla, these should be your biggest priorities for iOS users, who are otherwise trapped on a Safari.

Body: Sync funktioniert nicht. Lesezeichen, Favoriten von der Auf dem Rechner installierten Version fehlen, ebenso die gespeicherten Zugangsdaten. Bedienung ist auch nicht gewohnt wie am Rechner, das Menüband fehlt einfach. Sollte das hier wie am Rechner funktionieren gibt es volle Punkte.
Translated Body: Sync does not work. Bookmarks, Favorites of the version installed on the computer are missing, as well as the stored access data. Operation is also not used as on the computer, the ribbon is simply missing. If this works like on the computer, there are full points.

Author: hitomyon
Subject: 使える
Body: v10.4アプデで実用に問題無いレベルまで軽くなりました。あとはFireFox持ち前のカスタム性を発揮できれば最高です。
Translated Body: It became lighter to practically acceptable level with v 10.4 apde. It is the best if you can demonstrate the customity of having FireFox.

Author: Numan BAŞPINAR
Subject: Güncelleme sonrası ram tüketimi
Body:
Firefox çok uzun süredir hem pc de hemde tablette kullandığım bir uygulamaydı. Ama bu son güncellemeden sonra ikisinden de kaldırdım. 
1 - hem pc de hem tablette ram tüketimi çok fazla
2 - tablette aşırı derecede ısınma oluşturuyor. 
3 - pil tüketimi üst seviyede.
Translated Body: Firefox was a very long application that I used on both a PC and a tablet. But after this last update, I removed both of them. 1 - RAM consumption on both pc and tablet is too much 2 - overheating on the tablet. 3 - battery consumption at the top level.

Subject: „open in“ funktioniert nicht
Body: Eine heruntergeladene Datei (z. B. ein PDF) lässt sich nicht über die „Öffnen mit..“ Funktion in anderen Apps öffnen, obwohl es Firefox anbietet.

Subject: Too many fails
Body:
Any chance SOMETHING will be done to fix the issues people are bringing up because I’m getting close to deleting the app at this point.

Author: El zombra
Subject: Nachtmodus Firefox App
Body:
An sich ist es nett gemeint, jedoch:

- Die Menübalken oben und unten bleiben weiß und stören beim surfen. Wenn es aber ein Nachtmodus wie beworben sein soll, dann müsste bitte der ganze Bildschirm schwarz werden! Meine Augen und mein Partner werden sehr dankbar sein... 😜
Translated Body: In itself it is meant nicely, however: - The menu bars above and below remain white and interfere with surfing. But if it should be advertised as a night mode, then please, the whole screen would be black! My eyes and my partner will be very grateful ... 😜

Author: vedpre
Subject: Отличный браузер
Body: Проходит все формы авторизации на сайтах, в отличие от сафари, в некоторых случаях медленнее, но зато точно заходит в личный кабинет интернет магазина. Закладки синхронизирует с десктоп версией. Перешёл на него, пользуюсь, всё устраивает. Из минусов - слишком агрессивная иконка, огненный лис на чёрном фоне.
Translated Body: Passes all forms of authorization on sites, in contrast to safari, in some cases, more slowly, but it surely comes into the personal office of the online store. Bookmarks synchronizes with the desktop version. I switched to it, I use it, everything suits me. Of the minuses - too aggressive icon, a fiery fox on a black background.

Author: 飛翔王
Subject: ページ共有がおかしい
Body: ページを開いた状態で、共有するとタイトルとリンクが違って送信される。とくにLINEに共有すると、タイトルは見かけ上合っているので間違いに気づかず非常に困惑している。
Translated Body: With the page open, if you share it the title and the link are sent differently. Especially if I share it with LINE, the title seems to be apparently apparent, so I am very confused without noticing the mistake.

Author: Virginia Beacher
Subject: Smooth but missing standard features
Body: I'm switching to FF as my secondary iPhone browser, after Safari.  It's smooth and renders pages well.  BUT...  Being its 12/2017, I'm very surprised the iPhone version won't let me reorder the tabs.  It's such a basic feature that I'm astonished Mozilla dropped the ball on this feature.  I've seen several requests for this on the web that go back a couple years.  Come on Mozilla, get this feature added ASAP.

Author: roberuberu
Subject: Tres mal pensé !
Body:
Comment voulez faire une recherche si vous ne pouvez pas réorganiser vos onglets pour en mettre de côté ??
Et pour les favoris, impossible de les gérer ! Pourquoi separer les favoris mobiles des favoris desktop ?? Aucun interet si on ne peut pas reprendre un travail commencé sur une autre machine.
Et puis c'est lent.... très lent, sans parler de l'interface mal pensée... Firefox est en pleine descente, et ca va pas s'arreter !
Translated Body: How would you like to search if you can not rearrange your tabs to set aside? And for favorites, impossible to manage! Why separate mobile favorites from favorites desktop ?? No interest if we can not resume work started on another machine. And it's slow .... very slow, not to mention the wrong interface ... Firefox is downhill, and it will not stop!

Author: bbentham
Subject: Generally good; a few notable worts
Body:
This browser from Mozilla is generally good. It’s quick, tends to render pages faithfully and supports modern standards. 

The user experience leaves something to be desired though. The buttons and the thick lines therein are “cartoonish” and feel out of place in a modern application on iOS. 

The removal/closure of tabs is also difficult. The ‘x’ to close the tab is very small, and the swiping action isn’t fluid or very effective.

Opening shortcuts in Firefox by sharing them to the browser from other applications or the OS itself is also cumbersome. Instead of being able to open the links directly one has to either bookmark or add the tabs to a reading list. The latter is “somewhat” acceptable, but cumbersome. It is further complicated by the fact the Quantum version of the Firefox browser on the desktop uses Pocket as a reading list now, and it appears to be incompatible with the reading list on iOS.

Mit freundlichen Grüßen,

There are many unreached features based on Firefox Pc. For example, addons! It would be fantastic to be able to use the Mobile Browser like the one on the PC. Better website to PDF compilation. And much more! Please do not confuse the user. I know that with such a large open source project many people want to have their ideas implemented. Especially young developers. Nevertheless, the fan base, by age, at least 38+! You have to keep that in mind and not make it everyone's right. The bad reviews in the store are proof of that!
